title: Um wth

replies.body: He obviously didn't want your advice, so why give it?
What kind of comment is that? You expect D1va to be a mind reader?
No, but I expect him to understand that life etiquette also applies in game. If someone didn't ask for advice, why give it? This guy obviously didn't want it.

He gave it to help his team. He was being pro-active. Going by your attitude, NOBODY would help their team! So don't give me that life etiquette speel, thanks.
I'll tell you what's etiquette. Etiquette is not pissing off your teammates that try to help. He could have said "thanks for your advice, but I don't need it.", not what his reply was.
That is etiquette.

1. devourer is no longer in the game it instead does 3% max hp on hit ( which is huge when you think about it)
2. Rageblade has huge synergy with any champion that auto attacks alot

Pick whichever explanation fits the item you were talking about as sated rageblade isnt a thing.

Rageblade - More so that passive. 

If I understand from my reading on the "Phantom Hit" passive it comes with it doesn't actually proc the basic attack damage but only applies on hit effects (such as Bloodrazor, etc). Even if they did auto a lot I don't think it'd be useful unless they'd be able to make use of that phantom hit?

Phantom hit is the devourer passive, which doesnt exist anymore.

Rageblade is the aoe on hit effect that scales on ap and ad. and also gives you attack speed and ad on hit stacking up to 8 stacks.

Not sure if you've read the 6.9 Patch notes but Rageblade now stacks up to 6 times and triggers the old devourer "sated" effect of a phantom hit.

**" NEW ON-HIT Deals 15 magic damage on-hit
GET MAD Basic attacks grant +8% attack speed, +3 attack damage, and +4 ability power for 5 second (this effect stacks, granting Guinsoo’s Rage at max stacks)
MAXIMUM STACKS 8 ⇒ 6

_Guinsoo’s Rage
[NEW?] PHANTOM HIT During Guinsoo’s Rage, every other basic attack will trigger on-hit effects an additional time"**_

This is why I questioned the choice - Pre 6.9 go for your life but now it doesn't seem as viable if you can't abuse it.

Btw i also found this.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=07j4LgjfY5c

Apparently its meta now.

I just spat my drink so hard.

There are so many builds i can make with this.

Generally, if people want advice they will ask for it. Especially after new patches where not many people actually read patch notes and are stuck in their old habits. 

Some people that play Tristana are still building Guinsoos not for the "Guinsoos Rage" passive, but for the stacking AP,AD and AS. 
3/4 of Trists abilities have AP scalings, with her ult being a 1:1 scaling and her E & W scaling at a 0.5 ratio. Building guinsoos gives you the possibility to get up to 74(ish) AP, which increases her burst a lil more, her tower pushing potential significantly and just generally can be quite devastating. With the typical runaans second item, it stacks quickly.

It comes down to personal preference.

Yeah I can see that, but I would have imagined that for the same price you could get an IE spiking her a bit earlier? 

I guess it is a preference thing after all eh?
Perhaps they haven't seen the patch 6.9 notes and still want to copy Stixxay. Nothing's surprising in bronze these days.

Yeah I don't even think they noticed it tbh. 

But the build path, and stat distribution just seem wasted on Trist when she can get things that make her a lot stronger and stay relevant for a lot longer. If it was Kayle, Kog, XZ or all those other on hit peeps, sure go for it (though probs as a second item) but yeah :\
Rageblade is situationaly better to rush than other items but only if the person playing them is high elo and knows why they are doing it and how to abuse it

It's probably because a lot of people, ahem less-matured people, often take advice as a source of insult or attack, ("I know what i'm doing, why are you trying to tell me what to do?") I guess the only way to avoid conflicts such as these is to choose your words carefully, (E.g: "Hey trist, now that rageblade's been changed, is it still good to rush it first?") Although I cannot guarantee a polite response, it's a bit more 'softer' than asking why she is building rageblade, which could lead to a bit of misunderstanding.

I saw a video once, where a guy was saying the best way to chat in LoL was to treat everyone as if they have PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder). It's an interesting video to watch.

But hey, what do I know? I'm just another guy along the block. Feel free to ignore my advice if it doesn't agree with you. But remember, it's always a good practice to be open to advice, so you don't become like that trist ;)

Yeah looking back I probably could have worded it better {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} but at the same time I didn't feel that my wording used was really like triggering or anything like that. 

Can't say I'm surprised that they were rude about it though :\

Thanks!
